data.title: Ramanaidu's Death Created a Vacuum, Says Governor
data.meta_description: Narasimhan said in his condolence that Ramanaidu’s death created a vacuum not only in the Telugu filmdom but also in the film industry across India.
data.text:
HYDERABAD: Several prominent persons, film personalities and politicians have deeply mourned the demise of well-known film producer and recipient of Dadasaheb Phalke award Daggubati Ramanaidu here on Wednesday.

Governor ESL Narasimhan said in his condolence that Ramanaidu’s death created a vacuum not only in the Telugu filmdom but also in the film industry across India.

Telangana Chief Minister K Chandrasekhar Rao recalled the role played by Ramanaidu in shifting the Telugu film industry to Hyderabad. “Ramanaidu’s death is an irreparable loss to the cine world,” he said.

“Ramanaidu’s demise comes as a shock to the Telugu film industry. His contribution to Telugu cinema is outstanding,” Naidu said in a press release.

Recalling his meetings with the Movie Mogul, Chandrababu Naidu said, “Ramanaidu was a generous man who worked hard to churn out several blockbusters. The laurels he won made every Telugu person proud. They will be thankful to him forever for making some of the best Telugu movies. Ramanaidu’s contribution to the growth and development of Indian cinema is immeasurable,” the chief minister said.

Assembly speaker Kodela Sivaprasada Rao, deputy chief ministers KE Krishna Murthy and N Chinna Rajappa, finance minister Yanamala Ramakrishnudu, panchayat raj minister Ch Ayyannapatrudu and several other ministers also condoled the death of Ramanaidu. Union urban development minister M Venkaiah Naidu said that Ramanaidu had commitment towards his job and produced blockbusters. Ramanaidu also did good social work through his charitable trust, the Union minister said.

BJP Telangana state president G Kishan Reddy recalled the services of Ramanaidu rendered to the film industry for more than five decades. Union labour minister Bandrau Dattatreya, Telangana ministers Talasani Srinivas Yadav and Etela Rajender, Andhra Pradesh ministers Siddha Raghava Rao, P Sunitha, N Chinna Rajappa, Ch Ayyannapatrudu and others also mourned for Ramanaidu.
